ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Is PUT with no entity allowed?
ygData.msgSnippet: There may be better ways to model the particular use case(s) being discussed in that thread, but it is legal for PUT to have empty entities. Subbu

There may be better ways to model the particular use case(s) being  
discus=
sed in that thread, but it is legal for PUT to have empty  
entities.

Subb=
u

On May 29, 2008, at 2:13 AM, Jerome Louvel wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> We had =
an interesting question in the Restlet list regarding PUT  
> requests with=
 no entity. The idea is to create (or update) a  
> resource with an empty =
content, like a 'null' list item. See the  
> discussion thread:
> http://r=
estlet.tigris.org/servlets/BrowseList?list=3Ddiscuss&by=3Dthread&from=3D656=
617
>
> From an HTTP 1.1 specification point of view this isn't clear  
> e=
ither. Of course there are easy workarounds such as sending a  
> special '=
empty' representation (ex: "<content/>").
>
> Any thought?
>
> -- 
> Jerome=
 Louvel
> http://www.restlet.org
>
>
>
